name: 3-methyl-butyraldehyde oxime
Reason: 3-methyl-butyraldehyde oxime has a melting point influenced by functional groups relative to the base melting point of benzene, which is around 5°C. The methyl group introduces a rigid structure, which can participate in hydrogen bonding and increase the melting point by approximately +5°C. The oxime group introduces additional rigidity and hydrogen bonding potential, raising the melting point by approximately +10°C. The aldehyde group introduces a carbonyl functional group, which can participate in dipole interactions and increase the melting point by approximately +20°C.
